description: A Wikipedia-16px.png boundary marker, boundary stone or border stone is a robust physical marker that identifies the start of a land boundary or the change in a boundary, especially a change in a direction of a boundary. They have often been used to mark critical points on boundaries between countries or local administrations but have also been used to mark out the limits of private land-holdings especially in areas where fences or walls are impractical or unnecessary.
name: historic=boundary_stone

description: A Wikipedia-16px.png wayside cross is a historical (usually christian) cross. Frequently found along the way in most Europe: Germany, Austria, France, Italy, Poland, Ukraine and other predominantly catholic and orthodox cristian countries. If the cross is 'in use', maybe consider using man_made=cross.
name: historic=wayside_cross

description: A historical shrine often showing a religious depiction. Frequently found along the way in Germany, Austria, Italy, Czech Republic, Slovakia and probably elsewhere.
name: historic=wayside_shrine
